conclusion: Analyze the relationship between magnetic field, current, and spring scale readings to derive magnetic induction intensity.
Two spring scales vertically placed with a horizontal wire AB suspended below in a magnetic field directed into the paper.
Current I flows from A to B, reading on one spring scale is F1; when reversed to 2I, reading is F2.
Wire AB is in a uniform magnetic field B directed into the paper.
Force on wire due to magnetic field is F = BIL when current I flows from A to B.
Reading on one spring scale is F1 when current is I.
When current is reversed to 2I, reading on another spring scale is F2.
Force due to magnetic field when current is 2I is F2 = B(2I)L.
Difference in forces due to change in current is F2 - F1 = 3BIL.
Solving for B gives B = (F2 - F1) / (3IL).
Given F2 - F1 = 3BIL, find B = (3BIL) / (3IL) = B.
Magnetic induction intensity B is (F2 - F1) / (3IL).
